header.h: Business Center Renovation by EVO HOME
header.p1: The success of a business center largely depends on its appearance and functionality. A well-planned and professionally executed renovation improves not only aesthetics but also safety and comfort, increasing its appeal to potential tenants and visitors.
header.p2: Evo Home offers comprehensive turnkey renovation services for business centers in Rome, guaranteeing outstanding results backed by over 17 years of experience in this field.

process.p: Business center renovation requires compliance with numerous safety regulations and quality standards. Key CVI requirements include:

1.p:
Installation of high-efficiency HVAC systems (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) to ensure a comfortable environment all year round. 
Automatic fire suppression: Implementation of smoke and heat detection systems. Provision of automatic fire suppression systems such as sprinklers and inert gas systems.

2.p:
Quality certifications: Use of CE-certified materials to ensure compliance with European standards. Selection of eco-friendly and sustainable materials. 
Strength and durability: Use of fire-resistant materials such as treated steel and fire-resistant plaster.

3.p:
Fire detection systems: Installation of smoke and heat detectors. Connection to centralized monitoring systems. 
Alarm and evacuation systems: Implementation of audio and visual alert systems for quick evacuation. 
Sprinkler fire suppression: Installation of water, gas, or foam fire suppression systems.

4.p:
IT networks and communications: Design and installation of high-speed wired and wireless networks. Implementation of cybersecurity systems to protect company data. 
Building automation: Use of automation systems to control lighting, climate, and security.

5.p:
Building regulations: Compliance with local and national building codes. Obtaining all necessary permits before starting work. 
Safety regulations: Adherence to workplace safety standards and electrical system operation guidelines. Staff training on emergency response protocols and safety procedures.
